docs.abstract: A lawyer for John R. Bolton said he had information to share with impeachment investigators. But, so far, he will not defy the White House.
docs.snippet: A lawyer for John R. Bolton said he had information to share with impeachment investigators. But, so far, he will not defy the White House.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — John R. Bolton, President Trump’s former national security adviser, knows about “many relevant meetings and conversations” connected to a pressure campaign on Ukraine that House impeachment investigators have not yet been informed of, his lawyer told lawmakers on Friday.

headline.main: Bolton Said to Know of ‘Many Relevant Meetings’ on Ukraine, but Will Not Testify
headline.print_headline: Bolton Dangles Vital Knowledge Of Ukraine Push

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

byline.original: By Nicholas Fandos, Michael D. Shear and Peter Baker

docs.abstract: After a long delay, the justices agreed to decide whether the Trump administration may shut down a program known as DACA that shields young immigrants from deportation.
docs.snippet: After a long delay, the justices agreed to decide whether the Trump administration may shut down a program known as DACA that shields young immigrants from deportation.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For seven years, the so-called Dreamers — nearly 800,000 young men and women who were brought to the United States illegally as children — have lived in limbo, protected from immediate deportation but without the guarantee of any permanent future in the United States.

headline.main: It’s Now the Supreme Court’s Turn to Try to Resolve the Fate of the Dreamers
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court  Agrees to Hear ‘Dreamers’ Case

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)

byline.original: By Michael D. Shear and Adam Liptak

docs.abstract: In an interview on Fox News, the president blamed “the liberal establishment” for homelessness in American cities and said he “may intercede and do something to get that whole thing cleaned up.”
docs.snippet: In an interview on Fox News, the president blamed “the liberal establishment” for homelessness in American cities and said he “may intercede and do something to get that whole thing cleaned up.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For decades before moving into the White House, President Trump lived in the heart of Manhattan but apparently never noticed that his hometown had a homelessness problem.

headline.main: Trump Expresses Shock at Homelessness, ‘a Phenomenon That Started Two Years Ago’
headline.print_headline: Trump Sees Homelessness as a Recent, Liberal Problem That He Can Fix

docs.abstract: The government’s brief in the case, about the fate of the program that shields the young immigrants known as Dreamers, is the first salvo in a legal test of the president’s immigration agenda.
docs.snippet: The government’s brief in the case, about the fate of the program that shields the young immigrants known as Dreamers, is the first salvo in a legal test of the president’s immigration agenda.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Justice Department lawyers told the Supreme Court on Monday that President Trump acted lawfully in September 2017 when he decided to end an Obama-era program that protects young undocumented immigrants from deportation.

headline.main: Trump Has Right to End DACA, Justice Dept. Tells Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Argues Case On DACA At Top Court

docs.abstract: The housing department announced that it would distribute funds for disaster prevention efforts to Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands after first helping nine states.
docs.snippet: The housing department announced that it would distribute funds for disaster prevention efforts to Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands after first helping nine states.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration said on Friday that it would delay about $9 billion in disaster prevention funds to Puerto Rico and the United States Virgin Islands, distributing the money separately from funds for nine states, citing concerns over corruption and fiscal management.

headline.main: HUD Delays Disaster Preparation Money for Puerto Rico

docs.abstract: The Government Accountability Office, which looked at the relationship between income, wealth and longevity, found that poor people are living shorter lives and the rich are living longer.
docs.snippet: The Government Accountability Office, which looked at the relationship between income, wealth and longevity, found that poor people are living shorter lives and the rich are living longer.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The expanding gap between rich and poor is not only widening the gulf in incomes and wealth in America. It is helping the rich lead longer lives, while cutting short the lives of those who are struggling, according to a study released this week by the Government Accountability Office.

headline.main: Study Shows Income Gap Between Rich and Poor Keeps Growing, With Deadly Effects
headline.print_headline: Gap Between Rich and Poor Gets Bigger

docs.abstract: Consultants thought the speech would help President Trump’s re-election efforts. But experts said many of the president’s claims weren’t based in fact.
docs.snippet: Consultants thought the speech would help President Trump’s re-election efforts. But experts said many of the president’s claims weren’t based in fact.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Reviewing new polling data, consultants working for President Trump’s 2020 campaign discovered an unsurprising obstacle to winning support from two key demographic groups, millennials and suburban women. And that was his record on the environment.

headline.main: Trump Saw Opportunity in Speech on Environment. Critics Saw a ‘“1984” Moment.’
headline.print_headline: Trump Portrays U.S. as an Environmental Leader

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

byline.original: By Katie Rogers and Coral Davenport

docs.abstract: In a significant escalation, policymakers are seeking to undermine or discard research showing the most dire risks of inaction on climate change.
docs.snippet: In a significant escalation, policymakers are seeking to undermine or discard research showing the most dire risks of inaction on climate change.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has rolled back environmental regulations, pulled the United States out of the Paris climate accord, brushed aside dire predictions about the effects of climate change, and turned the term “global warming” into a punch line rather than a prognosis.

headline.main: Trump Administration Hardens Its Attack on Climate Science
headline.print_headline: In Climate Fight, Trump Will Put Science on Trial

byline.original: By Coral Davenport and Mark Landler

docs.abstract: Asked about a marking on the map that appeared to have been drawn to extend the storm’s possible path into Alabama, President Trump said he did not know how it got there.
docs.snippet: Asked about a marking on the map that appeared to have been drawn to extend the storm’s possible path into Alabama, President Trump said he did not know how it got there.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Trump displayed a large map of Hurricane Dorian’s path in the Oval Office on Wednesday, it was hard to miss a black line that appeared to have been drawn to extend the storm’s possible path into the state of Alabama.

headline.main: Trump Insists He Was Right About Hurricane Dorian Heading for Alabama
headline.print_headline: Erroneous Claim by Trump And the Map to Back It Up

byline.original: By Michael D. Shear and Zolan Kanno-Youngs

docs.abstract: President Trump’s speech at an event in Baltimore hit his usual lines as he careened between prepared remarks, ad-libbed attacks and boasts about his record.
docs.snippet: President Trump’s speech at an event in Baltimore hit his usual lines as he careened between prepared remarks, ad-libbed attacks and boasts about his record.
docs.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — Moments after Democrats took the debate stage on Thursday night, President Trump delivered a rambling and disjointed 68-minute speech accusing the news media and the “radical left” of wanting to destroy America.

headline.main: As Democrats Debate, Trump Offers Alternative: A Rambling Speech
headline.print_headline: Trump Delivers a Rambling Speech During the Debate
